alert.note: Alert for Loudoun (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 07 at 9:06PM EDT until May 10 at 1:37AM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Maryland... Virginia... Potomac River at Edwards Ferry affecting Loudoun and Montgomery Counties. For the Potomac River...including Paw Paw, Hancock, Dam Number Five, Shepherdstown, Harpers Ferry, Point of Rocks, Edwards Ferry, Little Falls...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY MORNING TO EARLY TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Potomac River at Edwards Ferry. * WHEN...From Sunday morning to early Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Floodwaters begin to enter the store at Whites Ferry. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 PM EDT Saturday the stage was 13.3 feet, or 1.7 feet below flood stage. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow morning to a crest of 17.7 feet early Monday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Monday evening. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 16.9 feet on 03/02/2021. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && River Name Fld Observed Sun Sun Sun Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time 2AM 8AM 2PM Stg Time Date Potomac River Edwards Ferry 15.0 13.3 Sat 8 pm 14.1 15.4 16.6 17.7 2am Mon &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/washington or www.weather.gov/baltimore. The next statement will be issued Sunday morning at 915 AM EDT.
